gw.pl.logging

Class LoggerCategory

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.pl.logging.LoggerCategory
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.logging.PLLoggerCategory

    public class LoggerCategory
extends java.lang.Object
    A LoggerCategory represents a pre-defined type of a Logger. Categories are hierarchical in nature, e.g. a particular instance of a plugin should use a LoggerCategory that extends PLUGIN. Most of these LoggerCategory loggers map to configurations in your "logging.properties" file, allowing you, for example, to map each category to a different log file. The logging levels in each category can be changed in the appropriate logging properties files, or through the administrative interface. Applications will supply their logger categories in subclasses.

    For example the log level of can be changed to DEBUG with 

    log4j.category.Plugin = DEBUG
    If a sub-logger is used e.g. LoggerCategory.CONFIG_DISPLAY the log4j category is appended 
    log4j.category.Config.Display
    Note: In the next release the Logger returned for each category will be of type Logger
    See Also:
    The Simple Logging Facade for Java (SLF4J) will be used in the 9 release for logging.

      • createLogger

        protected static Logger createLogger(java.lang.Object base,
                  java.lang.String subLogger)
        Static method - create a sublogger of existing logger. Note. The base parameter is intentionally defined as Object, so it could be anything that has toString() method returning a name.
        Parameters:
        base - - existing Logger or Logger name
        subLogger - - a subname to be concatenated with a period delimiter
        Returns:
        the logger instance
